javadoc:
Apply all function signature data types in a data type manager to
 any user defined label that has the same name as the function
 signature.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructs a new command to apply all function signature data types
 in the given data type manager.

params.name: set
params.comment:
set of addresses containing labels to match against function names.
 			  The addresses must not already be included in the body of any existing function.
  		  If null, all symbols will be processed

methods.name: getValidName
methods.comment: Strip off the last name of the string

return.comment: the last name in the string

methods.javadoc: Apply all descendants starting at node.
methods.name: applyDataTypes
methods.comment: Apply all descendants starting at node.

methods.name: isValidFunctionStart
methods.comment:
Check that the symbol looks like it is at the start of a function.
 There can be internal symbols that may match a function name.

return.comment: true if the symbol is at the start of a function flow

methods.name: lookupSymbol
methods.comment:
Lookup any program symbol with the same name as the function signature.
 Also allow for a single '_' in front of the symbol name.

params.name: symbolMap
params.comment: map of symbol names to all matching symbols

params.name: prefix
params.comment: optional prefix on symbol to lookup

return.comment: symbol definition; null if no symbol is found for the given name

name: ApplyFunctionDataTypesCmd
comment:
Apply all function signature data types in a data type manager to
 any user defined label that has the same name as the function
 signature.
